quizzes.question:
Fill in the blanks to output the numbers 5 to 20 using a while loop.
[!raw!]
a = 5
{0} a <= 20
  puts a
  {1} += 1
{2}
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Loops[/h1]

[b]Loops [/b]are used to execute the same block of code a specified number of times. 
The [b]while [/b]loop executes a block of code while its condition is [b]true[/b].
[b]For example:[/b][code format="rb" codeId="1003"]x = 0
[b]while [/b]x < 10
  puts x
  x += 1
[b]end[/b][/code]
This will output the numbers 0 to 9. After the loop control variable becomes 10, the condition x < 10 evaluates to [b]false [/b]and the loop ends its execution.
[note]If we leave out the x+=1 statement, the loop will run forever, because the condition will remain [b]true[/b]. This situation is called an infinite loop.[/note]

quizzes.question:
How many times will this loop execute?
x = 15
until x <= 10
  puts x
  x -= 2
end
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]until Loops[/h1]

The [b]until [/b]loop is the opposite of a while loop: it will run while its condition is [b]false[/b].
[b]For example:[/b][code format="rb" codeId="1004"]a = 0
[b]until [/b]a > 10
  puts "a = #{a}"
  a +=2
[b]end[/b][/code]
[note]This will print all even numbers from 0 to 10.[/note]
